alert.note: Alert for Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:53AM EDT until May 08 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following county, Upshur. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 953 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - As of 915 AM, the Sand Run gauge was at 6 ft. At 6 ft, minor flooding of low-lying areas occurs along Sand Run Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Overhill and Tallmansville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
